sn35.72:3: "What do you think, bhikkhu, do you regard the eye thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self’?"
sn35.72:5: "Good, bhikkhu! And here, bhikkhu, you should clearly see the eye as it really is with correct wisdom thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self.’ Thus this first base for contact will be abandoned by you for no future renewed existence.[n.37]Āyatiṃ apunabbhavāya.Spk: Here, "no future renewed existence" is Nibbāna. The meaning is, "It will be abandoned by you for the sake of Nibbāna."
sn35.72:6–8: "Do you regard the ear thus … ? Thus this second base for contact will be abandoned by you for no future renewed existence … .
sn35.72:9: "Do you regard the mind thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self’?"
sn35.72:11: "Good, bhikkhu! And here, bhikkhu, you should clearly see the mind as it really is with correct wisdom thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self.’ Thus this sixth base for contact will be abandoned by you for no future renewed existence."
